description: Initiates a signing job to be performed on the code provided. Signing jobs are viewable by the ListSigningJobs operation for two years after they are performed. Note the following requirements: You can call the  DescribeSigningJob and the  ListSigningJobs actions after you call StartSigningJob. For a Java example that shows how to use this action, see StartSigningJob.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The S3 bucket that contains the object to sign or a BLOB that contains your raw code. s3 (dict) --- The S3Source object. Name of the S3 bucket. Key name of the bucket object that contains your unsigned code. Version of your source image in your version enabled S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: Key name of the bucket object that contains your unsigned code.

nested_params.name: version
nested_params.description: Version of your source image in your version enabled S3 bucket.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The S3 bucket in which to save your signed object. The destination contains the name of your bucket and an optional prefix. s3 (dict) --- The S3Destination object. bucketName (string) --- Name of the S3 bucket. prefix (string) --- An S3 prefix that you can use to limit responses to those that begin with the specified prefix.

nested_params.name: prefix
nested_params.description: An S3 prefix that you can use to limit responses to those that begin with the specified prefix.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: The name of the signing profile.

parameters.name: clientRequestToken
parameters.description: String that identifies the signing request. All calls after the first that use this token return the same response as the first call. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: jobId
nested_items.description: The ID of your signing job.

nested_items.name: jobOwner
nested_items.description: The AWS account ID of the signing job owner.
